main event: An Eastern Airline pilot observed a round, white ball with a fiery tail flashing across the horizon, which eventually exploded. The sighting occurred at 28/0751 GMT near Charleston, W.Va.
interesting points: The object was observed flying in a southwest direction at approximately 45 degrees elevation.
The observer was a senior controller in the USAF and suggested that the object appeared to be a meteorite.
No photographs were taken of the sighting.
The weather at the time of the sighting was clear, with various wind conditions at different altitudes.
The observer's sighting is consistent with a typical satellite or meteor appearance.
sighted object: round, white ball with a fiery tail
